channel.title: Security?
channel.description: Hello all :P I have a little problem with my dad, and it is that he wont let me portforward on the router. He says that we are going to have our router secure, he dont want it to be hacked. He is also changing the username and password to login to I have no idea how I could get it, or how I could get him to allow me to portforward... Help please? :P

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

[quote=“Classic, post:17, topic:452524”][quote author=neroxx link=topic=555403.msg4070722#msg4070722 date=1344319652]

[quote author=t4 link=topic=555403.msg4070636#msg4070636 date=1344305976]

for home use you really only need IPTables lol…
[/quote]…

???
[/quote]???

You’re an idiot neroxx[/quote]Yes, I know it Classic…

Read full topic

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:13, topic:452524”]If he attempts to change the password on your router just go up to your physical router and press the reset button. Obviously have your default internet login details, router user/pass and specific settings at hand because you’ll probably have to reconfigure everything after a hard reset.

Just portforward it yourself, I’m sure he wont keep checking…[/quote]cause telling somebody how to get their father mad at them is such a good idea

Read full topic

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

If he attempts to change the password on your router just go up to your physical router and press the reset button. Obviously have your default internet login details, router user/pass and specific settings at hand because you’ll probably have to reconfigure everything after a hard reset.

Just portforward it yourself, I’m sure he wont keep checking…

Read full topic

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:9, topic:452524”][quote author=neroxx link=topic=555403.msg4067683#msg4067683 date=1344046442]

[quote author=t4 link=topic=555403.msg4067673#msg4067673 date=1344044629]
he sounds like he knows a lot about networking
[/quote]He dont, but he is scared to get the network hacked -.-

If I reset it, dont I need to do anything else after? Does it continue work without doing anything with the settings?
[/quote]keep in mind, any good network security costs a lot of money. I think you and him both should read over this

http://www.cisco.com/web/solutions/smb/products/security/security_primer.html

cisco is a leading IT product site for firewalls, routers, etc. This gives a mild overview of what exactly true network security means.[/quote]Thanks man!

Read full topic

he sounds like he knows a lot about networking
[/quote]He dont, but he is scared to get the network hacked -.-

If I reset it, dont I need to do anything else after? Does it continue work without doing anything with the settings?[/quote]keep in mind, any good network security costs a lot of money. I think you and him both should read over this

http://www.cisco.com/web/solutions/smb/products/security/security_primer.html

cisco is a leading IT product site for firewalls, routers, etc. This gives a mild overview of what exactly true network security means.

Read full topic

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

hmm most people just get a pin and hold down the reset button on the back of the router for 7 secs so the router will go back to factory settings or you could ask him what the wifi pass is

Read full topic

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:2, topic:452524”][quote author=neroxx link=topic=555403.msg4066177#msg4066177 date=1343913608]
Hello all I have a little problem with my dad, and it is that he wont let me portforward on the router. He says that we are going to have our router secure, he dont want it to be hacked. He is also changing the username and password to login to I have no idea how I could get it, or how I could get him to allow me to portforward… Help please?
[/quote]

Give me your #, I’ll call your Father. I sound like a 40 year old man. I’ll tell him what’s what.[/quote]hehe Good idea, but it would cost you lots… We live in different countries xD

item.title: Security?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

[quote=“neroxx, post:1, topic:452524”]Hello all I have a little problem with my dad, and it is that he wont let me portforward on the router. He says that we are going to have our router secure, he dont want it to be hacked. He is also changing the username and password to login to I have no idea how I could get it, or how I could get him to allow me to portforward… Help please? :P[/quote]go get a firewall and port through it. ( not talking about that windows firewall crap ) you should be good then. I doubt you would ever get ddosed …maybe dosed but with a good enough firewall in place one dos attack won’t do anything to you.

Read full topic
